Title: Prove that $ 1.462 \le \int_0^1 e^{{x}^{2}}\le 1.463$
Content:
Prove the following integral inequality: $$ 1.462 \le \int_0^1 e^{{x}^{2}}\le 1.463$$ This is a high school problem. So far i did manage to prove that the integral is bigger than $1.462$ by using Taylor expansion, namely:
$$1.462\le 1.4625=\int_0^1 1+x^2+\frac{x^4}{2}+\frac{x^6}{6}+\frac{x^8}{24}+\frac{x^{10}}{120}\le  \int_0^1 e^{{x}^{2}}$$
For the right bound i'm still looking for a way. However, i wonder if there is an elegant way to solve both sides.
